Button

Use the button component to add a call to action. The type of call to action is defined by the button label or icon.

Installation 

                  
                    npm i @govflanders/vl-ui-button

or 

                  
                    yarn add @govflanders/vl-ui-button

Usage

Import SASS 

                  
                  @import "vl-ui-button/src/scss/button";

Make sure your sass --include-path includes node_modules/@govflanders/.

Button primary

Use the primary button as a call to action. The button prompts the user to perform an action in a flow, or to complete a transaction. Primary buttons are filled by default.

      <button class="vl-button">
    Gegevens opslaan
  </button>

Button disabled

Use the disabled button to inform the user that the button function is inactive. A disabled button is grayed out. To ensure that all button interactions are disabled, add the HTMl5 attribute "disabled".

      <button class="vl-button vl-button--disabled"disabled>
    Gegevens opslaan
  </button>

Button error

Use the error button to emphasize the importance or the consequence of an action.

      <button class="vl-button vl-button--error">
    Gegevens opslaan
  </button>

Button with icon after text

A button with a text label followed by an integrated icon

      <button class="vl-button vl-button--icon-after">
    Contactpersoon opslaan
        <i class="vl-button__icon vl-button__icon--after vl-vi vl-vi-location" aria-hidden="true"></i>
  </button>

Button with icon before text

A button with an integrated icon in front of the text label

      <button class="vl-button vl-button--icon-before">
    <i class="vl-button__icon vl-button__icon--before vl-vi vl-vi-location" aria-hidden="true"></i>
        Contactpersoon opslaan
  </button>

Block button with icon before text

A block button with an integrated icon in front of the text label

      <button class="vl-button vl-button--icon-before vl-button--block">
    <i class="vl-button__icon vl-button__icon--before vl-vi vl-vi-location" aria-hidden="true"></i>
        Contactpersoon opslaan
  </button>

Block button with icon after text

A block button with a text label followed by an integrated icon

      <button class="vl-button vl-button--icon-after vl-button--block">
    Contactpersoon opslaan
        <i class="vl-button__icon vl-button__icon--after vl-vi vl-vi-location" aria-hidden="true"></i>
  </button>

Button block

A block button is displayed as a block element, taking the width of the parent container.

      <button class="vl-button vl-button--block">
    Gegevens opslaan
  </button>

Button large

A button with a larger font size, aimed at catching the user's attention

      <button class="vl-button vl-button--large">
    Gegevens opslaan
  </button>

Button wide

A button with a larger size than the default button

      <button class="vl-button vl-button--wide">
    Gegevens opslaan
  </button>

Button narrow

A smaller variant of the button

      <button class="vl-button vl-button--narrow">
    Gegevens opslaan
  </button>

Button loading

Use a loading button to indicate the loading state after user interaction. It is recommended to choose this type of button when an application is fetching data after a submit action, for example. It acts as a confirmation that a user action is being executed.

      <button class="vl-button vl-button--loading"disabled>
    Gegevens verwerken
  </button>

Button secondary

Use a secondary button to display one or more extra buttons in addition to the primary button. For example, to add a Back button next to a (primary) Save button. Take into account that secondary buttons are not filled by default.

      <button class="vl-button vl-button--secondary">
    Gegevens opslaan
  </button>

Button secondary with icon before

Use a secondary button to display one or more extra buttons in addition to the primary button. For example, to add a Back button next to a (primary) Save button. Take into account that secondary buttons are not filled by default.

      <button class="vl-button vl-button--secondary vl-button--icon-before">
    <i class="vl-button__icon vl-button__icon--before vl-vi vl-vi-location" aria-hidden="true"></i>
        Gegevens opslaan
  </button>

Button secondary error

Use a secondary button to display one or more extra buttons in addition to the primary button. For example, to add a Back button next to a (primary) Save button. Take into account that secondary buttons are not filled by default.

      <button class="vl-button vl-button--secondary vl-button--error">
    Gegevens opslaan
  </button>

Button secondary error with icon before

Use a secondary button to display one or more extra buttons in addition to the primary button. For example, to add a Back button next to a (primary) Save button. Take into account that secondary buttons are not filled by default.

      <button class="vl-button vl-button--secondary vl-button--error vl-button--icon-before">
    <i class="vl-button__icon vl-button__icon--before vl-vi vl-vi-location" aria-hidden="true"></i>
        Gegevens opslaan
  </button>

Button tertiary

Use a tertiary button to display one or more extra buttons in addition to the primary button. Tertiairy buttons have a more discrete look and feel. Take into account that tertiary buttons are not filled by default.

      <button class="vl-button vl-button--tertiary">
    Gegevens opslaan
  </button>

Button tertiary with icon before

Use a tertiary button to display one or more extra buttons in addition to the primary button. Tertiairy buttons have a more discrete look and feel. Take into account that tertiary buttons are not filled by default.

      <button class="vl-button vl-button--tertiary vl-button--icon-before">
    <i class="vl-button__icon vl-button__icon--before vl-vi vl-vi-location" aria-hidden="true"></i>
        Gegevens opslaan
  </button>

Button tertiary error

Use a tertiairy loading button to indicate the loading state after user interaction. It is recommended to choose this type of button when an application is fetching data after a submit action, for example. It acts as a confirmation that a user action is being executed.

      <button class="vl-button vl-button--tertiary vl-button--error">
    Gegevens verwerken
  </button>

Button icon

Button with integrated icon. Usable for screenreaders by the hidden text.

      <button class="vl-button vl-button--icon">
    <i class="vl-button__icon vl-vi vl-vi-location" aria-hidden="true"></i>
      <span class="vl-u-hidden">Gegevens opslaan</span>
  </button>
